title: Better error message when OpenOptions lacks either .append() or .write()

labels.name: C-enhancement
labels.description: Category: An issue proposing an enhancement or a PR with one.

labels.name: T-libs
labels.description: Relevant to the library team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
It appears that when you open a file, OpenOptions requires either .append(true) or .write(true). If you don't do that, you get:

`panicked at 'called `Result::unwrap()` on an `Err` value: Os { code: 22, kind: InvalidInput, message: "Invalid argument" }'
` 

"Invalid argument" isn't helpful in tracking down the problem. A better error message would be helpful.

To duplicate the error, do this:

        let mut file = OpenOptions::new()
            .create(true) 
            .truncate(true)
            // .append(true)
            // .write(true)
            .open("myfile.txt")
            .unwrap();

Uncomment one of the lines above to make it work.

I'm opening this as a blank issue because I'm not sure if it's a bug or a feature request.
